column1:
冲突chōngtū
  • 这两个国家因边境问题发生了冲突。
    These two countries had a conflict over border issues.
  • 我们应该避免在会议上发生不必要的冲突。
    We should avoid unnecessary conflicts during the meeting.
"conflict" or "clash."

It refers to a serious disagreement, argument, or confrontation, often resulting in tension or discord. This term can be used in various contexts, from interpersonal relationships to international relations.conflict5

大脑dà nǎo
  • 大脑是人体最复杂的器官之一。
    The brain is one of the most complex organs in the human body.
  • 学习新技能可以帮助提高大脑功能。
    Learning new skills can help improve brain function.
"brain."

It is the organ in the head of vertebrates that controls the body's functions, processes information, and enables thought, memory, and emotion.cerebrum; brain5

灰色huī sè
  • 天空布满了灰色的云朵。
    The sky is filled with gray clouds.
  • 这个问题存在很多灰色地带。
    There are many grey areas in this issue.
 "gray" or "grey" in Chinese, referring to the color. It can be used in various contexts, from describing objects and scenes to symbolizing emotions or situations.gray; pessimistic5

肌肉jīròu
  • 通过锻炼可以增强肌肉力量。
    Exercising can enhance muscle strength.
  • 她每天做瑜伽来保持肌肉的柔韧性。
    She does yoga daily to maintain her muscle flexibility.
"muscle."

It's the tissue in the body that can contract, allowing for movement and physical activity.muscle5

郊区jiāoqū
  • 我们住在城市的郊区。
    We live in the suburbs of the city.
  • 郊区的空气比城市中心清新。
    The air in the suburbs is fresher than in the city center.
suburbs or "outskirts" of a city or town.

It's the area that surrounds the urban center and is typically characterized by a lower population density, more residential areas, and often more green spaces compared to the densely populated urban core.Suburb5

邻居línjū
  • 我们的邻居非常友好。
    Our neighbors are very friendly.
neighbor or "neighborhood."

It refers to someone who lives nearby, typically in the same area, building, or adjacent residence.neighbor5

漫画mànhuà
  • 他喜欢在空闲时间阅读日本漫画。
    He likes to read Japanese manga in his free time.
  • 她梦想成为一名漫画家。
    She dreams of becoming a comic artist.
comics or "manga." It can be used to describe any kind of comic books, graphic novels, or similar visual storytelling media.Cartoon5

射击shèjī
  • 她对射击运动非常感兴趣。
    She is very interested in the sport of shooting.
  • 他在射击俱乐部学习如何正确使用手枪。
    He is learning how to properly use a handgun at the shooting club.
shooting or "firing,"Shooting5

神经shénjīng
  • 神经系统是人体最复杂的系统之一。
    The nervous system is one of the most complex systems in the human body.
  • 他的腿部神经受到了伤害。
    The nerves in his leg were damaged.
"nerve" or "nervous."

It is commonly used in both physiological and psychological contexts. In physiology, it relates to the nerves in the human body, which are part of the nervous system. In a more colloquial sense, it can also be used to describe someone's mental or emotional state, often implying sensitivity or irritability.nerve5

硕士shuòshì
  • 他正在攻读硕士学位。
    He is currently pursuing a Master's degree.
  • 硕士论文通常需要进行深入研究。
    A Master's thesis usually requires in-depth research.
Master's degree or a "Master's" in the context of academic education.

It is a postgraduate academic degree awarded by universities upon completion of a course of study demonstrating mastery or a high-order overview of a specific field of study or area of professional practice.master5

胃wèi
  • 吃太多油腻的食物对胃不好。
    Eating too much greasy food is bad for the stomach.
  • 她因为胃痛去看了医生。
    She went to see a doctor because of stomach pain.
"stomach."

It is an organ in the digestive system that plays a crucial role in digesting food.stomach5

卧室wòshì
  • 我的卧室不大，但很温馨。
    My bedroom is not big, but it's very cozy.
  • 他们刚刚重新装修了卧室。
    They just renovated their bedroom.
BedroomBedroom5

亚军yàjūn
  • 虽然只是亚军，但她感到非常自豪。
    Although she was only the runner-up, she felt very proud.
  • 尽管努力，他们最终只获得了亚军。
    Despite their efforts, they ultimately only got the second place.
the "runner-up" or "second place" in a competition. Runner-up5

邀请yāoqǐng
  • 我们邀请了所有的朋友参加我们的婚礼。
    We invited all our friends to our wedding.
  • 她高兴地接受了聚会的邀请。
    She happily accepted the invitation to the party.
to invite or "invitation."

It can be used both as a verb (to invite) and as a noun (invitation). Invitation5

一带yí dài
  • 长江一带的风景非常迷人。
    The scenery around the Yangtze River area is very charming.
  • 我们计划去云南一带旅游。
    We plan to travel around the Yunnan area.
region, areaarea; surroundings; region; district5

因而yīn’ér
  • 他工作非常努力，因而获得了晋升。
    He worked very hard, and thus he was promoted.
  • 这个地区缺水，因而农作物难以生长。
    This area lacks water, therefore crops are hard to grow.
therefore or "thus"

It is a conjunction used to indicate a cause-and-effect relationship.thus5

由此yóu cǐ
ChatGPT:
  • 她读了信，由此得知他的死讯。
    She read the letter and thus learned of his death.
  • 她仔细观察市场变化，由此预测了趋势。
    She observed the market changes carefully and thereby predicted the trend.
  • 他们进行了深入调查，由此发现了真相。
    They conducted a thorough investigation and thus uncovered the truth.
Grammar Wiki:
  • 人们 滥 用 农药 和 其他 化学 原料，由此 产生 了 一系列 严重 的 食品 安全 问题。
  • 在 案发 现场 我们 发现 了 一些 蚂蚁 和 蜂蜜，由此 我们 发现 了 罪犯 的 身份。
  • 最近 很多 贪官 因为 情妇 举报 而 落马，由此 看来，情妇 反腐 也 是 一 个 好 方法。
  • 由此 可见，政府 进行 彻底 地 政治 和 经济 改革 是 多么 必要。
Common Phrases:
  • 由此可见
  • 由此看来
  • 由此说来
from this, "therefore," or "thus." It is often used to indicate a conclusion or a result that is derived from the previously mentioned situation or fact.from this; therefrom; thus5

预期yùqī
  • 他的表现超出了我们的预期。
    His performance exceeded our expectations.
  • 这次会议达到了预期的目标。
    The meeting achieved its expected goals.
to expect, "to anticipate," or "expected." It is often used to describe something that is foreseen or anticipated in the future.expect; anticipate5

原先yuánxiān
  • 原先这里是一片森林，现在变成了一个购物中心。
    Originally, this was a forest, but now it has become a shopping center.
  • 我原先打算周末去爬山，但因为天气不好而取消了。
    I originally planned to go hiking this weekend, but I canceled it due to bad weather.
originally or "at first." It is often used to describe the original state or condition of something before it changed.Original5

怨yuàn
  • 他对她抱有深深的怨恨。
    He harbors deep resentment towards her.
  • 他的话语中充满了怨言。
    His words were full of complaints.
resentment, grievance, or blame. It is often used to express feelings of dissatisfaction or bitterness towards someone or something.blame ; complain; resentment; enmity5

再次zài cì
  • 他再次获得了冠军。
    He won the championship once again.
  • 我希望再次见到你。
    I hope to see you again.
once again or "another time." It's often used to indicate repetition or the recurrence of an action or situation. once more; once again; one more time5

展览zhǎnlǎn
  • 这次艺术展览吸引了成千上万的参观者。
    This art exhibition attracted thousands of visitors.
  • 他的作品将在国际艺术展览中展出。
    His works will be exhibited at an international art exhibition.
exhibition or "show." It can refer to any display or presentation of art, products, skills, etc., in a public space. exhibition5

珍惜zhēnxī
  • 我们应该珍惜时间，因为它非常宝贵。
    We should cherish time, as it is very precious.
  • 这是一个难得的机会，你应该珍惜。
    This is a rare opportunity, you should treasure it.
to cherish, "to treasure," or "to value highly."

It's used to express the idea of holding something in high regard due to its importance, rarity, or personal significance. cherish5

真诚zhēn chéng
  • 他以真诚的态度向她道歉。
    He apologized to her with a sincere attitude.
  • 真诚的友谊是人生最大的财富之一。
    Sincere friendship is one of the greatest treasures in life.
 "sincere" or "genuine." sincere; genuine; true; genuineness5

挣钱zhèng qián
  • 他想创业挣钱，实现自己的梦想。
    He wants to start a business to earn money and realize his dreams.
  • 他每天工作很努力，就是为了挣钱养家。
    He works hard every day just to earn money to support his family.
to earn money or "to make money." It's a common phrase used to describe the act of obtaining income, usually through work or business.make money; earn money5

之中zhī zhōng
  • 在这次会议之中，我们讨论了许多重要问题。
    During this meeting, we discussed many important issues.
  • 他的名字在所有候选人之中最为突出。
    His name stands out among all the candidates.
among, "in the middle of," or "within." It is often used to specify that something is part of a larger group, time period, or situation.in; in the midst of; among5

只见zhǐ jiàn
  • 我走进房间，只见桌子上放着一束鲜花。
    I walked into the room and just saw a bunch of flowers on the table.
  • 夜晚，我抬头望向天空，只见满天繁星。
    At night, I looked up at the sky and only saw stars filling the sky.
often used to set the scene in a narrative, meaning "only see" or "just see." It's typically used to describe a situation where the speaker or a character suddenly notices something, focusing the listener's or reader's attention on a specific aspect or action.only see; see5

治理zhìlǐ
  • 治理污染是我们这个时代的重大挑战。
    Controlling pollution is a major challenge of our era.
  • 政府正在努力治理城市的交通拥堵问题。
    The government is working hard to manage the city's traffic congestion problem.
to govern, "to manage," or "to control," and it can be used in a variety of contexts, from political governance to the management of environmental issues.Government5

竹子zhúzi
  • ……让更多的人愿意卖竹子制品。
    ... convince more people to buy things made of bamboo.
    https://www.thechairmansbao.com/china-targets-bamboo-as-eco-alternative-to-plastic/
  • 这个花园里种满了竹子。
    This garden is filled with bamboo.
  • 竹子可以用来制作家具和工艺品。
    Bamboo can be used to make furniture and handicrafts.
"bamboo."

It's a type of fast-growing, woody grass that is known for its hollow, segmented stems and is widely found in East Asia. Bamboo is notable for its versatility and is used in various ways, from construction and furniture making to culinary uses and traditional art.Bamboo5

主导zhǔdǎo
  • 他主导了这个科研项目的开发。
    He led the development of this scientific research project.
  • 这家公司在市场上的主导地位日益稳固。
    This company's dominant position in the market is increasingly solidified.
to lead, "to dominate," or "to guide." It is often used to describe a leading or controlling influence in various contexts, such as in projects, trends, discussions, or developments.leading5

助手zhùshǒu
  • 我需要一个助手来帮我处理文件。
    I need an assistant to help me handle the documents.
assistant in English. It refers to a person who assists or helps someone else, typically in a work or professional context.assistant5

转化zhuǎn huà
  • 这项技术可以将太阳能转化为电能。
    This technology can convert solar energy into electrical energy.
  • 他努力将挫折转化为前进的动力。
    He strives to turn setbacks into motivation to move forward.
to transform or "to convert." It's used to describe a change or conversion from one state, form, or substance into another. This term can be applied in various contexts, including science, personal development, economics, and more.change; transform5

资产zīchǎn
  • 他们正在评估公司的流动资产。
    They are assessing the company's current assets.
  • 在经济危机中，许多人的资产缩水了。
    Many people's assets diminished during the economic crisis.
  • 他个人的资产包括房产、股票和一些珍贵艺术品。
    His personal assets include real estate, stocks, and some valuable art pieces.
refers to "assets." This term is widely used in financial and business contexts to denote resources owned by an individual or an organization that have value and can potentially provide future benefits. Assets can include cash, real estate, investments, inventory, equipment, or other types of property.capital; asset5

自愿zìyuàn
  • 这项工作是完全自愿的，没有任何强制性。
    This work is completely voluntary, with no compulsion whatsoever.
  • 他自愿放弃了比赛。
    He voluntarily gave up the competition.
voluntary or "of one's own free will." It's often used to describe actions or decisions made by choice, without external pressure or coercion.voluntarily5

总数zǒng shù
  • 这次活动的参与者总数超过了两百人。
    The total number of participants in this event exceeded two hundred.
  • 公司今年的销售总数达到了一个新高。
    The company's total sales this year reached a new high.
total number or "sum." It is used to refer to the aggregate amount or the final count of something.tote; sum; totality5

阻碍zǔ’ài
  • 不要让恐惧阻碍你追求梦想。
    Do not let fear hinder you from pursuing your dreams.
  • 官僚主义可能会阻碍决策过程。
    Bureaucracy can obstruct the decision-making process.

 "to hinder," "to obstruct," or "to impede."

It is used to describe something that interferes with progress or movement, either in a physical or metaphorical sense.
hinder5

尊敬zūnjìng
  • 他因为他的诚实和专业精神受到人们的尊敬。
    He is respected for his honesty and professionalism.
  • 尊敬他人意味着理解和接受他们的不同。
    Respecting others means understanding and accepting their differences.
respect or "to respect." It's often used to express esteem or high regard for someone, typically due to their status, age, experience, or achievements.respect5

尊重zūnzhòng
  • 我们应该尊重每个人的意见。
    We should respect everyone's opinion.
  • 尊重老师是很重要的。
    Respecting teachers is very important.
to respect in the sense of acknowledging and valuing someone's rights, opinions, or individuality. It implies a kind of egalitarian respect, recognizing and appreciating differences without necessarily implying superiority or inferiority.

As opposed to 尊敬 (zūnjìng),

which is more about "reverence" or "high respect," often used in contexts where there is a sense of admiration, particularly towards someone who is considered superior in some way, such as in age, status, wisdom, or achievement.respect5

遵守zūnshǒu
  • 所有司机都应该遵守交通规则。
    All drivers should abide by traffic rules.
  • 双方都必须严格遵守这个协议。
    Both parties must strictly comply with this agreement.
to abide by, "to comply with," or "to observe."

It is used to express the action of following rules, laws, guidelines, or principles.comply with5

名单míng dān
  • 他的名字在参加会议的名单上。
    His name is on the list of attendees for the meeting.
  • 我们需要准备一个嘉宾名单。
    We need to prepare a guest list.
"list" or "roster."

It typically refers to a list of names of people or items.list2

能够néng gòu
  • 他能够说流利的法语和西班牙语。
    He can speak fluent French and Spanish.
  • 我希望能够在明年完成我的学位。
    I hope to be able to complete my degree next year.
"to be able to" or "can."

It's used to express capability or the possibility of doing something.be able to; can2

实现shíxiàn
  • 他努力工作，终于实现了自己的梦想。
    He worked hard and finally achieved his dream.
  • 为了实现这个项目，我们需要更多的资源和支持。
    We need more resources and support to realize this project.
"to realize," "to achieve," or "to fulfill."

It refers to the accomplishment or bringing into reality of a goal, dream, plan, or idea.Realization2

爱心àixīn
  • 他对待动物充满了爱心。
    He treats animals with great love and kindness.
  • 他给无家可归的人提供了爱心午餐。
    He provided a lovingly prepared lunch for homeless people.
literally translates to "love heart" and is often used to represent the concept of love, compassion, or kindness. It can refer to a loving or caring attitude, philanthropy, or charitable actions.love3

安装ānzhuāng
  • 我正在我的电脑上安装新软件。
    I am installing new software on my computer.
  • 他们在办公室安装了新的空调系统。
    They installed a new air conditioning system in the office.
"to install" or "to set up." It's typically used in the context of installing equipment, software, machinery, or assembling and setting up various items.install3

按àn
  • 请按电梯按钮。
    Please press the elevator button.
  • 医生让他按一下疼痛的部位。
    The doctor asked him to press on the painful area.
by itself, it primarily means "to press" or "to push."press; push; check; restrain3

把握bǎwò
Confidence in an Outcome:
  • 我对这次考试没有太大把握。
    I'm not very confident about this exam.
Understanding or Comprehension:
  • 他对这个问题有很好的把握。
    He has a good understanding of this issue.

Grasp an Opportunity 
  • 我要把握这个机会。

means "to grasp" in a literal sense, but it's more commonly used in a figurative sense to mean "to seize," "to control," or "to be sure of." It often refers to having confidence or certainty about something or the ability to influence or control an outcome.grasp3

白（副）bái
  • 我等了他一整天，结果他没来，真是白等了。
    I waited for him all day, but he didn't show up. It was a waste of time waiting.
  • 他们白跑了一趟，因为商店已经关门了。
    They went there for nothing because the store was already closed.
"in vain," "for nothing," or to indicate that an action has been fruitless or without the desired outcome.without results; in vain; waste efforts3

班级bān jí
Referring to a Group of Students:
  • 我们班级有四十名学生。
    Our class has forty students.
a "class" or "grade" in the context of an educational setting. It is used to describe a group of students who are taught together or the class as a group entity within a school.class3

板bǎn
"Board" or "Plank"
  • 木板
  • 我需要一块切菜板。
In Expressions Related to Firmness or Rigidity:
  • 面无表情，板着脸

  • "Board" or "Plank"
  • In Expressions Related to Firmness or Rigidity
board; plank; shutter3

办理bànlǐ
  • 你需要去银行办理开户手续。
    You need to go to the bank to handle the account opening procedures.
  • 请稍等，我正在为您办理退款。
    Please wait, I am processing your refund.
"to handle," "to process," or "to deal with." It is often used in contexts involving the execution or management of tasks, formal procedures, or official matters.handle3

保安bǎo ān
  • 酒店的保安非常警觉。
    The hotel's security guards are very vigilant.
  • 商场加强了保安措施。
    The mall has strengthened its security measures.
"security" or "security guard." It is commonly used in contexts related to safety, protection, and security services.security guard; public security; ensure safety3

保持bǎochí
  • 即使在压力下，他也能保持冷静。
    Even under pressure, he is able to maintain his composure.
  • 在困难时期，保持乐观很重要。
    It's important to keep optimistic during difficult times.
  • 请保持房间的整洁。
    Please keep the room tidy.
"to keep" or "to maintain," is used in contexts that involve sustaining a current state, condition, or level over time.keep3

保存bǎocún
Preserving Food:
  • 把食物放在冰箱里可以保存得更久。
    Putting food in the refrigerator can preserve it for a longer time.
Saving Data or Information:
  • 请确保你保存了所有的文件。
    Please make sure you have saved all the files.
Preserving the Environment or Nature:
  • 我们必须采取行动保存自然环境。
    We must take action to preserve the natural environment.
"to save" or "to preserve." It is often used in contexts related to keeping something in its current state or ensuring its longevity.Preservation3

保留bǎoliú
Reserving Something:
  • 我已经帮你保留了一个座位。
    I have reserved a seat for you.
Retaining a Right or Opinion:
  • 公司保留最终决定权。
    The company retains the final decision-making right.
"to reserve," "to retain," or "to preserve," depending on the context.Retain3

保险bǎoxiǎn
  • 我买了一份汽车保险。
    I bought car insurance
  • 努力学习是你未来的保险。
    Studying hard is insurance for your future.
insuranceInsurance3

报到bàodào
  • 所有一年级学生必须在九月一日前报到。
    All first-year students must register before September 1st.
  • 他被要求到警局报到。
    He was required to report to the police station
"to check in," "to register," or "to report for duty." It is commonly used in contexts where one is arriving and registering at a specific place, such as a school, a workplace, or an event.register,check in3

报道bàodào
  • 记者正在现场报道最新事件。
    The journalist is reporting the latest event on the scene.
  • 学校通过校园广播报道重要通知。
    The school announces important notices through campus broadcasting.
"to report" or "report." It is most commonly used in the context of journalism and media, referring to the act of reporting news or information, or the report itself.report3

被子bèizi
  • 冬天的时候，我喜欢用厚重的被子。
    In winter, I like to use a thick quilt.
  • 他把被子叠得整整齐齐。
    He folded the comforter neatly.
"quilt" or "comforter."

It's a type of bedding—a thick, soft cover traditionally filled with down, feathers, or a synthetic alternative, used to keep warm while sleeping.quilt3

变为biàn wéi
  • 冬天，这个湖会变为一片冰面。
    In winter, this lake turns into a sheet of ice.
  • 那个小村庄现在已经变为一个繁忙的城市。
    That small village has now become a bustling city.
"to turn into" or "to become,"
